channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Europe
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'We were very lucky nobody died': How a Covid-19 outbreak in an Irish town spiraled
item.description: Misha was living in a hotel in a leafy suburb of Ireland's capital city under the country's controversial asylum seeker accommodation system when a letter arrived.

item.title: Are cell phone calls on airplane flights inevitable?
item.description: Ah, holiday travel. Between huge crowds and weather delays, flying during this time of year is hectic. Now close your eyes and imagine the entire scenario with one additional annoyance: Loud talkers yammering into their cell phones at 35,000 feet.

item.title: 'Hamlet' in the skies? The story behind Taiwan's newest airline
item.description: Debuting its first flights in January 2020, Taiwanese start-up STARLUX Airlines could be the first new player in 30 years to upend the island's duopoly aviation market.

item.title: Copenhagen's new Metro is a thing of beauty
item.description: In Copenhagen, traffic is usually caused by the two-wheel variety of transportation: the bicycle.

item.title: The hotel designed for likes
The best luxury bars in Budapest
Budapest 's fine dining revolution
Luxury atop one of the world's tallest hotels
item.description: From traditional souks, mosques and UNESCO World Heritage sites, to futuristic skyscrapers, Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, offers an eclectic mix of old and new.

item.title: They say he lived to be 168. Here's how
item.description: There are a number of destinations around the world famed for the longevity of their residents.

item.title: This fire has been burning for 4,000 years
item.description: "This fire has burned 4,000 years and never stopped," says Aliyeva Rahila. "Even the rain coming here, snow, wind -- it never stops burning."

item.title: Alleged assault of Black politician shines spotlight on Europe's lack of racial diversity
item.description: The killing of George Floyd in the United States and the subsequent Black Lives Matter protests around the world have given reason for some awkward, long-overdue soul-searching in the European Union about the treatment of its Black and ethnic minority citizens.

item.title: Glasgow stabbing attack: Live updates
Danish PM postpones wedding for Covid-19 meeting
item.description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has postponed her wedding to attend the European Council meeting next month, she said in an Instagram post on Thursday.

item.title: Kosovo President charged with war crimes cancels White House visit
item.description: Kosovan President Hashim Thaci has been indicted for war crimes allegedly committed during the Kosovo conflict in the late 1990s, leading him to cancel a planned trip to the White House this weekend for talks with Serbian leaders.

item.title: Russia kicks off referendum on constitutional changes that could keep Putin in power until 2036
item.description: Russia on Thursday kicked off early voting in a national referendum on controversial amendments to the country's constitution that could allow President Vladimir Putin stay in power until 2036, amid reports that the process had been marred by election tampering and compulsory voting.

item.title: Coronavirus being exploited to undermine democracies, former world leaders warn
item.description: The outbreak of Covid-19 and subsequent pandemic has led to an alarming uptick in authoritarian behavior by governments across the globe, who are using the crisis to silence critics, an open letter signed by more than 500 former world leaders and Nobel Laureates claims.

item.title: Belgium's King Leopold II has a 21st century nemesis. He's 14 years old
item.description: Noah, a slight teenager wearing jeans and sneakers, is dwarfed by the bronze statue of Belgium's King Leopold II astride a horse. The statue, set high on a concrete plinth, has stood opposite the Royal Palace in Brussels since 1926.

item.title: Welcome to the whack-a-mole stage of coronavirus
item.description: Germany is trying to stop a new Covid-19 outbreak from developing into a full-blown second wave of the virus.

item.title: Russia kicks off lavish Victory Day parade following coronavirus delay
item.description: An extravagant Victory Day military parade commenced Wednesday in Moscow, as Russian President Vladimir Putin looks to solidify support ahead of a national referendum that could keep him in power until 2036.

item.title: Germany imposes fresh lockdown after coronavirus outbreak at meat factory
item.description: Germany placed more than 360,000 people in the western state of North-Rhine Westphalia back into lockdown on Tuesday, after a coronavirus outbreak at a meat processing factory.

item.title: Smelly durian fruit sends six to hospital and forces evacuation
item.description: Twelve German postal workers received medical treatment and dozens more were evacuated due to a pungent suspect package -- which turned out to be a shipment of the notoriously smelly durian fruit.

item.title: Siberia's warm weather is an 'alarming sign': scientist says
item.description: Siberia's prolonged period of unusually warm weather is an "alarming sign," according to climate change scientists.

item.title: Germany's coronavirus reproduction rate soars after massive outbreak at meat plant
item.description: The reproduction number (R) of the coronavirus in Germany has risen sharply, the country's center for disease control has said, after an outbreak at a meat processing plant infected hundreds of workers.

item.title: Vladimir Putin strongly hints he will run again for president
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has hinted strongly in a new interview that he will run again for president, if a series of constitutional amendments allowing him to do so are approved in a July 1 referendum.

item.title: Riots in Stuttgart, Germany, leave dozens arrested and injured
item.description: A drug arrest in the German city of Stuttgart erupted into violent riots and widespread looting on Saturday night.

item.title: How Britain has failed to deal with systemic racism
item.description: Racism in Britain may attract less global attention than in the United States, but it is no less present -- and Black Britons say it is past time for the country to face up to its colonial history and act to stamp out racial inequalities.

item.title: My Black Life Matters
item.description: This poem by Piers Harrison-Reid, a nurse and performance poet based in the east of England, was written to coincide with the release of CNN's extensive new poll on racial inequality in Britain.

item.title: Belarus strongman faces mass protests after jailing of his main rivals
item.description: Mass protests are spreading across Belarus as opposition to the reelection campaign of President Alexander Lukashenko grows, local media and human-rights organizations have reported.

item.title: Russia reopens ahead of Victory Day and Putin referendum -- but coronavirus threat remains
item.description: Next Wednesday marks a major event for Russia: Russian President Vladimir Putin will preside over a rescheduled Victory Day parade to mark the 75th anniversary of the end of World War II in Europe.

item.title: Pope Francis warns society against reverting to individualism after the pandemic
item.description: Pope Francis has warned the world against returning to the "illusion of individualism" after the coronavirus pandemic ends.
